channel.title: Home on Society for Open Software
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Society for Open Software

item.title: Cruxipher
item.description: For ATMOS 2022, we worked with Crux on Cruxipher - a CTF event that tested software development, cryptography and UNIX skills.

item.title: Shell Basics
item.description: The Shell Basics workshop was conducted on the first of October. The workshop covered the basics of using shell interfaces such as bash and zsh. Poster for the workshop: (Made in GIMP, as usual)

item.title: Dualbooting Workshop
item.description: Our very first event as a society was a workshop on dualbooting Linux with Windows. It took place on 19th June, 2022 at F204 in the OAB. Here is a clip from the event: This was the poster for the event: (Made in GIMP, of course)

item.title: Members
item.description: Sarthak Shah - President Site: untyped.ml Github Soumitra Shewale - Secretary Site Github

item.title: Apply
item.description: We require all members to run some GNU/Linux distro on their laptops in single or multi-boot. Some experience with using the command-line shell is expected, but not strictly necessary. If you feel like you satisfy these requirements, you can apply by filling this form. Upon receiving the form, we will send you an e-mail with interview details. Please note that there might be slight delays in interview timings if there are ongoing exams.

item.title: About
item.description: BITS-SOS is an independent society established in BITS Pilani, Hyderabad Campus with the aim of increasing awareness about free and open source software and raising the rate of GNU/Linux adoption on campus. We regularly hold events and workshops related to GNU/Linux and open source technologies such as Bash and Git. Our members are listed here along with their details. To join us, click ./apply. You can find out more about free software here.
